page.title: 06A Market Garden, Alcester
page.content: When we visited Springfields Nurseries, the owner showed us some of the crops he grows.These include lettuce, tomatoes, beans, leeks, celery, cabbages, sprouts and flowers. People were coming to buy bedding plants and hanging baskets. There are 50 acres of land with 6 large greenhouses and several poly- houses.These are made with polythene instead of glass, because it is cheaper. In one polyhouse we saw soil being sterilized. A large plastic sheet covered the soil and hot steam was piped under it. The sheet blew up in a dome-shape. It was hot to touch. The steam kills all the germs and bugs which attack young plants. We also saw a massive boiler which heats water to make steam and keeps the greenhouses hot in winter.
